DOC.brief_summary: This is a single site, prospective, non-blinded, non-randomized, non-interventional study designed to evaluate the effect of changes in alveolar minute ventilation on the measurement of respiratory heat loss (enthalpy).
DOC.brief_title: Effect of Alveolar Minute Ventilation on Respiratory Gas Heat Content
DOC.criteria: age greater than 18 years scheduled for an elective surgical procedure with an anticipated duration of more than 2 hours requiring general anesthesia and positive pressure ventilation using an endotracheal tube patient status ASA 1, 2 or 3 no significant cardiovascular or respiratory disease supine surgical position Adults unable to give primary consent age less than 18 years pregnancy prisoners preexisting cardiac or pulmonary disease infusion of inotropic drugs positive end expiratory pressure (PEEP) requirements >8 cm H2O increased intraabdominal pressure (e.g. planned surgical pneumoperitoneum or ascitis) intraoperative patient position other than supine
